climbs.name: With A Hammer In His Hand

content.description:
This is right next to the trail. 

  Look for the massive right pointing block ledge feature to stand start upon. 

  Climb straight up through huge dirty (for now) features until you need to trend right to the top out. 

  The top out is to the right of the roof, so you will also need to trend right, meaning you have to climb through thinner crimps to gain the good top to the right of the small Laurel growing from the top.
content.location:
This is right next to the trail. 

  Look for the massive right pointing block ledge feature to stand start upon.

content.description:
Filthy, but will be great when cleaner. I climbed much of this problem but didnt finish it due to the lack of a stick brush. I just couldn't clean the last 2 holds to reach the top. Someone should top it out. The line will be really fun!

 At the far right side of the wall, look for the chunky portion to walk up onto to begin the line. gain the deep jug and climb straight up through small edges to top out same as "Man With A hammer".
content.location: At the far right side of the wall, look for the chunky portion to walk up onto to begin the line.

content.description:
John Henry is an American folk hero, notable for having raced against a steam powered hammer to drive railroad spikes and won, only to die in victory with his hammer in his hand... I figured a railroad name would be appropriate for the wall.

 The John Henry Wall is the first decent climbable face on the trail, and it comes right after trestle #44. This will be on the right hand side of the trail.

 The wall is relatively tall (but not too bad) so I would recommend a pad for this one.

 This thing is in no way clean and BADLY needs scrubbing. Its filthy, but the features are massive and fun. With some work this could be a great face.
